name: flanken
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U or plural ] a cut of meat from the front end of the ribs (= the bones that curve around from the back to the chest) of a cow: Place the flanken in a pot, cover with water, and bring to a fast boil. Flanken is short ribs cut across the bone instead of between the bones. Flanken are a tough cut of meat, with a lot of fat. Compare
short rib
[ U ] a dish made by boiling this cut of meat: Flanken is made from beef that has been simmered for a long time in water with vegetables.
More examplesFewer examplesAdd the flanken to the pot with the sugar, salt and some lemon juice.As a treat, we had vegetable soup with flanken.The short ribs can be cut flanken style (across the bones) or English style (between the bones).We grilled the flanken with chilli, sesame and ginger.Horseradish is a traditional accompaniment to flanken.
